intro: Hutchinia indica, commonly known as the Indian hutchinia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. It is often found in forested areas and thrives in moist, well-drained soil. The plant has been used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
